#summary Instructions for building JebGL from the source code.
#labels Featured

= Building JebGL =
== Get the source ==
Get the latest code
{{{
svn checkout http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ jebgl-read-only
}}}
or a release (e.g. 0.1)
{{{
svn checkout http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/releases/0.1/ jebgl-read-only
}}}

== Get JOGL ==
You need some jars from the JOGL project. You can download JOGL [http://jogamp.org/deployment/webstart/archive/ here]. You need both jogl and gluegen, e.g. `jogl-v2.0-rc2.tar.xz` and `gluegen-v2.0-rc2.tar.xz`. The build instructions are as follows (they may not be up to date, check [http://jogamp.org/jogl/doc/HowToBuild.html JOGL's page] for reference)
{{{
xzcat jogl-v2.0-rc2.tar.xz | tar x
xzcat gluegen-v2.0-rc2.tar.xz | tar x
ln -s gluegen-v2.0-rc2 gluegen
cd jogl-v2.0-rc2/make
ant
}}}

  * [http://jebgl.com/webstart/jogl.all.jar jogl.all.jar]
  * [http://jebgl.com/webstart/nativewindow.all.jar nativewindow.all.jar]
  * [http://jebgl.com/webstart/gluegen-rt.jar gluegen-rt.jar]

Put them in a directory called `webstart` inside your newly created `jebgl-read-only` directory

== Build ==
Open a terminal and call
{{{
make
}}}
in the `jebgl-read-only` directory. This should build a jar file called `jebgl.jar`
